meanings.definition: To remedy or rectify a situation
meanings.sent1: She is redressing the mistake she made by apologizing.
meanings.sent2: The tailor is redressing the hem of the dress to make it shorter.
meanings.sent3: Redressing the balance, she added more sugar to the recipe.
meanings.sent4: His kind words are redressing the sadness in her heart.
meanings.sent5: Redressing the issue quickly will prevent further problems.

meanings.definition: The act of correcting or making right
meanings.sent1: The redressing of the error was swift and effective.
meanings.sent2: Redressing of grievances is an important part of conflict resolution.
meanings.sent3: The redressing of the painting made it look brand new.
meanings.sent4: Her redressing of the situation brought peace to the group.
meanings.sent5: The redressing of the misunderstanding cleared up any confusion.

meanings.definition: Compensation or reparation for a wrong or injury
meanings.sent1: The redressing for the damages was fair and just.
meanings.sent2: Redressing for the loss included financial compensation.
meanings.sent3: She received redressing for the inconvenience caused.
meanings.sent4: The redressing for the mistake was more than expected.
meanings.sent5: His redressing for the error showed his sincerity.
